profile.hotelInfoLocationValue: 5 min walk to Masjid al‑Haram (via King Fahd Gate)
profile.hotelDirectionsValue: 5 minutes walk to Masjid al-Haram via King Fahd Gate. Nearest metro station: Al Haramain High Speed Rail
profile.hotelNote1: Check-in time is from 3:00 PM onwards
profile.hotelNote3: Breakfast is served daily from 6:00 AM to 10:00 AM
profile.hotelNote4: Prayer times are displayed in the hotel lobby
profile.ritualScheduleSubtitle: Your day-by-day guide for the sacred journey
profile.ritualActivities1: Enter Ihram and spend the day and night in Mina. Pray Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib and Isha shortened but not combined.
profile.ritualActivities2: Stand in Arafah for Wuquf, then depart towards Muzdalifah. Pray Dhuhr and Asr combined and shortened.
profile.ritualActivities3: Stay overnight in Muzdalifah and collect pebbles for Rami. Pray Maghrib and Isha combined and shortened.
profile.ritualActivities4: Return to Mina for Rami, perform sacrifice, shave/trim hair, and perform Tawaf al‑Ifadah and Sa'i.
profile.ritualActivities5: Rami of the three Jamarat after Dhuhr. Stay in Mina remembering Allah and resting.
profile.ritualActivities6: Final Rami of three Jamarat, depart Mina, and perform Tawaf al‑Wada' before leaving Makkah.

announcement1.title: Bus Departure Updated
announcement1.description: Group A will be at 5:30 pm from gate 4. Please ensure all pilgrims are ready.
announcement1.fullContent:
Bus Departure Updated

Group A will be at 5:30 pm from gate 4. Please ensure all pilgrims are ready and have their boarding passes. The bus will depart promptly at 5:30 pm. Late arrivals will not be accommodated.

announcement2.title: Zam Zam Distribution
announcement2.description: Bottle will be given after Asar prayer at Tent B. Please coordinate with your group.
announcement2.fullContent:
Zam Zam Distribution

Bottle will be given after Asar prayer at Tent B. Please coordinate with your group members and ensure everyone receives their allocation. Distribution will start at 4:00 PM.

announcement3.title: Wheelchair Assistance Available
announcement3.description: Medical team will provide wheelchair support for elderly pilgrims during Tawaf.
announcement3.fullContent:
Wheelchair Assistance Available

Medical team will provide wheelchair support for elderly pilgrims during Tawaf. Please register your group members who need assistance at the medical tent before 6:00 AM.

announcement4.title: Important: Prayer Time Change
announcement4.description: Fajr prayer time has been adjusted. New time is 4:45 AM. Please inform your group.
announcement4.fullContent:
Important: Prayer Time Change

Fajr prayer time has been adjusted due to seasonal changes. New time is 4:45 AM. Please inform all members of your group and ensure they are aware of this change.

wishlist.title: Wishlist
wishlist.essentialDayBagBody: Keep a small cross‑body bag ready with water, snacks, prayer mat, charger and a copy of your permit.
wishlist.stayConnectedBody: Save your group leader's phone number and meeting point for every major ritual day.
wishlist.prepareWalkingBody: Add blister plasters, spare socks and light snacks to your wishlist so you don't forget them.
wishlist.notesGuideBody: Write short notes about elderly pilgrims, medical needs or wheelchair users in your group.
wishlist.saveLocationsDesc: Pin your hotel, Mina camp, meeting points and favourite masjid entrances so you can quickly navigate back even in a crowd.
wishlist.wheelchairAssistanceDesc: Request wheelchair support inside the Haram or during long walks between sites. Add how many pilgrims and the time you need help.
wishlist.bookShuttleDesc: Reserve seats on official shuttle buses between Makkah, Mina, Arafat and Muzdalifah with your group and selected time window.
wishlist.hotelRoomRequestsDesc: Share special requirements with your organiser such as early check-in, late checkout, extra bedding or room close to the lift.
wishlist.medicalPharmacyDesc: Let your guide know if you need doctor support, prescription refills or nearby pharmacy recommendations during Hajj.
wishlist.noteBody: These items will be included in the package under your profile. Your guide will confirm them within 48 hours.

essentials.title: Essentials
essentials.ihramChecklistBody:
• Make intention for Hajj or ʿUmrah from your home or at the miqāt.
• Take a full ghusl, trim nails and remove unwanted hair.
• Wear two plain white cloths (for men) or modest loose clothing for women.
• Avoid perfume after making intention.
• Begin reciting the Talbiyah with a present heart.
essentials.dailyPrayerSubtitle: Inside Masjid al-Ḥarām & the Ḥaram area
essentials.dailyPrayerBody:
• Arrive early for prayers; keep your prayer mat and small water bottle with you.
• Keep walkways and doors clear and avoid blocking stairs.
• Place your shoes in a bag and keep them with you to avoid losing them.
• Maintain calm, avoid loud conversations and unnecessary phone use in the masjid.
essentials.healthSafetySubtitle: Stay strong during long days of Hajj
essentials.healthSafetyBody:
• Drink water frequently (especially Zamzam); avoid too much sugar and caffeine.
• Wear comfortable walking shoes or sandals and break them in before travel.
• Use sun protection: umbrella, sunglasses, and light-coloured clothing.
• Keep a basic kit: pain relief, plasters, ORS, any regular medication, and copies of prescriptions.
essentials.whatToPack: What to Pack in Your Day Bag
essentials.whatToPackBody:
• Small prayer mat, pocket Qur'an or app, and dhikr counter.
• Foldable water bottle, dates or light snacks, wet wipes and tissues.
• Power bank and short charging cable.
• Copy of passport, Hajj/Umrah permit, hotel card and emergency contact numbers.
essentials.understandingPackageSubtitle: Know what is included before you travel
essentials.understandingPackageBody:
• Confirm hotel names, check-in/out dates, and distance from the Ḥaram.
• Ask which services your mutawwif provides in Minā, ʿArafāt, and Muzdalifah.
• Save hotline numbers (Saudi emergency 911, your group leader, transport coordinator).
• Keep digital and printed copies of all bookings and permits.
essentials.usingDigitalIDBody:
• Always wear your official wristband and keep your digital ID accessible in the app.
• Check that your name, nationality and group number are correct.
• If separated from your group, show your ID to security or volunteers; they will guide you back.
• Never give your passport or ID to unknown people—only authorised staff or your group leader.
essentials.movingBetweenSitesBody:
• Confirm bus pickup points and departure times with your group leader the night before.
• Keep your small day bag ready with water, snacks and prayer essentials.
• Stay close to your group flag or sign; avoid walking alone in heavy crowds.
• If you miss the group, move to the nearest information desk and call your leader.
essentials.duaBeforeLeavingBody:
"Bismi llāhi, tawakkaltu ʿalā llāh, lā ḥawla wa-lā quwwata illā bi llāh."

Meaning: In the Name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah; there is no power and no might except with Allah.
Recite this as you step out of your room or house and trust that Allah will protect your journey.
essentials.talbiyahSubtitle: From entering Ihram until the start of Ṭawāf al-Ifāḍah
essentials.talbiyahBody:
"Labbayka llāhumma labbayk, labbayka lā sharīka laka labbayk, inna l-ḥamda wa-n-niʿmata
laka wa-l-mulk, lā sharīka lak."

Meaning: Here I am, O Allah, here I am. Here I am, You have no partner, here I am. Surely all praise,
grace and dominion belong to You. You have no partner.
essentials.duaAtArafatSubtitle: Most virtuous supplication on the Day of ʿArafah
essentials.duaAtArafatBody:
"Lā ilāha illā llāhu waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, lahu l-mulku wa lahu l-ḥamdu
wa huwa ʿalā kulli shay'in qadīr."

Meaning: There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, alone without partner. To Him belongs
the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things capable.
essentials.afterStoningBody:
After stoning the first and second Jamarah, stand facing the Qiblah, raise your hands and make
personal duʿā for yourself, your family, and the Ummah. Ask for forgiveness, steadfastness and
acceptance of your Hajj. Speak to Allah from your heart.

callSupport.title: Call Support
callSupport.subtitle: Get immediate help based on your need
callSupport.confirmCallText: You are about to call {title}. Do you want to proceed?
callSupport.speaker: Speaker

step1.title: Enter Ihram (if not already in Ihram)
step1.description: Make intention for Hajj, wear Ihram, and recite the Talbiyah while travelling towards Mina.

step2.title: Arrive in Mina
step2.description: Settle in your tent, pray Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib and Isha shortened but not combined.

step3.title: Engage in Dhikr & Du'a
step3.description: Spend the day in worship, Qur'an, and making du'a; prepare spiritually for the Day of Arafah.

step1.title: Depart from Mina to Arafah
step1.description: Leave Mina with your group and proceed to the plains of Arafah, reciting Talbiyah on the way.

step2.title: Wuquf in Arafah
step2.description: Pray Dhuhr and Asr combined and shortened, then stand in du'a facing the Qiblah until sunset.

step3.title: Depart to Muzdalifah
step3.description: Leave Arafah calmly after Maghrib without praying there; head to Muzdalifah for the night.

step1.title: Pray Maghrib & Isha
step1.description: Pray Maghrib and Isha combined and shortened with one Adhan and two Iqamahs.

step2.title: Stay Overnight
step2.description: Sleep in Muzdalifah under the open sky, increasing in dhikr and du'a.

step3.title: Collect Pebbles
step3.description: Collect 49–70 small pebbles that will be used for Rami at the Jamarat in Mina.

step1.title: Return to Mina & Rami al‑Jamarah al‑Aqabah
step1.description: Stone the large pillar (Jamarah al‑Aqabah) with seven pebbles while saying "Allāhu Akbar".

step2.title: Sacrifice (Hadi)
step2.description: Arrange your sacrifice (Hadi) through your campaign or official slaughterhouse.

step3.title: Shaving / Trimming the Hair
step3.description: Men shave or shorten the hair; women trim a fingertip length from their hair.

step4.title: Tawaf al‑Ifadah & Sa'i
step4.description: Travel to Masjid al‑Haram to perform Tawaf al‑Ifadah and Sa'i for Hajj.

step1.title: Rami of Three Jamarat
step1.description: Stone all three pillars (small, middle, large) with seven pebbles each, in order.

step2.title: Return to Tent
step2.description: Spend time in Mina remembering Allah, reflecting and resting in your tent.

step1.title: Rami of Three Jamarat
step1.description: Again stone the three Jamarat with seven pebbles each, in the same order as previous day.

step2.title: Leave Mina (Before Maghrib)
step2.description: Depart Mina before Maghrib if choosing to stay two days; otherwise remain for a third day.

step3.title: Tawaf al‑Wada'
step3.description: Perform the farewell Tawaf around the Ka'bah before leaving Makkah.

day1.summary: Enter Ihram and spend the day and night in Mina.

day2.summary: Stand in Arafah for Wuquf, then depart towards Muzdalifah.

day3.summary: Stay overnight in Muzdalifah and collect pebbles for Rami.

day4.summary: Rami, sacrifice, hair, and Tawaf al‑Ifadah.

day5.summary: Rami of the three Jamarat and stay in Mina.

day6.summary: Final Rami, depart Mina, and perform Tawaf al‑Wada'.

fatwa.title: Fatwa
fatwa.feverQuestion: Can i delay Tawaf due to fever?
fatwa.feverAnswer: Yes, you may delay Tawaf if you have fever or illness. Scholars like Mufti Taqi Usmani and Sheikh Ibn Baz allow it, but you must perform it before leaving Makkah.
fatwa.tawafQuestion: Can i delay Tawaf due to fever?
fatwa.tawafAnswer: Yes, you may delay Tawaf if you have fever or illness. Scholars like Mufti Taqi Usmani and Sheikh Ibn Baz allow it, but you must perform it before leaving Makkah.
fatwa.illnessQuestion: What should I do if I fall ill during Hajj?
fatwa.illnessAnswer: If you fall ill during Hajj, you should seek medical help immediately. Many rituals can be performed by proxy if you are unable to perform them yourself due to illness. Consult with your guide or a qualified scholar.
fatwa.womenQuestion: Can women perform Hajj without a mahram?
fatwa.womenAnswer: According to most scholars, a woman should be accompanied by a mahram (close male relative) for Hajj. However, if she is part of a trusted group with other women, some scholars permit it. It is best to consult with a qualified scholar.
fatwa.proxyQuestion: Can someone perform Hajj on behalf of another person?
fatwa.proxyAnswer: Yes, proxy Hajj (Hajj Badal) is permissible if the person is deceased, elderly, or physically unable to perform Hajj themselves. The proxy must have already performed their own Hajj.
fatwa.ritualQuestion: What if I miss a ritual during Hajj?
fatwa.ritualAnswer: If you miss a ritual, you should perform it as soon as possible. If it is too late, you may need to offer a sacrifice (dam) or perform it in the next Hajj. Consult with a qualified scholar for specific guidance.

hajjPermit.title: Hajj Permit
hajjPermit.permitReminderBody: Keep your digital and printed permit with you at all checkpoints and arrive early at your departure location to avoid delays.

hajjStepDetail.readGuidance: Read this guidance carefully before you move with your group so you don't miss any pillar of Hajj.

hotelStay.locationValue: 5 min walk to Masjid al‑Haram (via King Fahd Gate)
hotelStay.viewHotelMap: View hotel map and walking directions
hotelStay.guideline1: Keep your Hajj ID visible at all times in the hotel and lobby.
hotelStay.guideline2: Stay with your group when moving between hotel and Haram.
hotelStay.guideline3: Follow the check‑in and key collection process explained by your guide.
hotelStay.guideline4: Respect quiet hours, especially after Isha, so pilgrims can rest.
hotelStay.checkInStep1: Proceed to the group reception desk with your passport and Hajj ID.
hotelStay.checkInStep2: Receive your room assignment and key card from the group supervisor.
hotelStay.checkInStep3: Confirm prayer times, meal times and assembly points with your guide.
hotelStay.scheduleText1: Check in, freshen up, and attend the brief orientation in the hotel prayer area.
hotelStay.scheduleText2: Rest, then prepare for Umrah with your group; review Ihram rules and meet in lobby at the agreed time.
hotelStay.scheduleText3: Join group visits to Masjid anNabawi, Riyad alJannah slots, and ziyarah of key sites, as per your campaign schedule.
hotelStay.hotelStayRemindersBody: Keep your Hajj ID visible at all times, follow check-in procedures, and stay with your group when moving between hotel and Haram.

minaTent.scheduleText1: Arrive in Mina, pray Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib and Isha shortened (no combining), spend the night in worship and rest.
minaTent.scheduleText2: After Fajr in Mina, depart with your group to the plains of Arafat for Wuquf until Maghrib.
minaTent.scheduleText3: Return from Muzdalifah, perform Rami of Jamarah alAqabah, sacrifice, shave/trim hair and perform Tawaf alIfadah.
minaTent.scheduleText4: Stay in Mina, perform Rami of all three Jamarat after Zawal each day, spend the nights in your tent.
minaTent.tentRemindersBody: Keep your Hajj ID visible, stay with your group, and follow all safety guidelines while in Mina.

prayerTime.title: Prayer Times
prayerTime.detailedGuide: Detailed guide for Tawaf and all rituals of Hajj
prayerTime.essentialDuasDescription: Complete collection of duas for each ritual day

proxySacrifice.title: Proxy Sacrifice (Hadi)
proxySacrifice.proxySacrificeNoteBody: Your sacrifice is performed by certified agents in Mina. Keep your reference ID safe and wait for completion status before shaving or trimming your hair.
proxySacrifice.videoProofSubtitle: Watch the recorded sacrifice for your Hadi offering.
proxySacrifice.sacrificeWithEaseSubtitle: Your Hadi is carried out according to Sunnah in the official Mina slaughterhouse, ensuring it is valid and accepted in shā' Allāh.
proxySacrifice.selectSacrificeSubtitle: Choose the type and quantity of animal for your Hadi sacrifice

qibla.locationDescription: To detect the Qibla direction accurately, please allow location access.
qibla.rotatePhone: Rotate your phone until it points to Qibla

contactAdmin.title: Contact Admin
contactAdmin.formSubtitle: Have a question or need assistance? Send a message to the admin team.
contactAdmin.subject: Subject:

card1.title: Managing Pilgrim Check-ins
card1.subtitle: Daily check-in procedures
card1.body:
• Verify each pilgrim's digital ID and wristband upon arrival.
• Record attendance in the group management system.
• Note any special needs or medical conditions.
• Confirm tent and bus assignments before departure.
• Update group status in real-time during movement between sites.

card2.title: Handling Pilgrim Requests
card2.subtitle: Request management workflow
card2.body:
• Respond to requests within 2 hours during active hours.
• Update request status: Pending → In Progress → Completed.
• Use the "Respond" feature to communicate directly with pilgrims.
• Escalate urgent medical or safety requests immediately.
• Keep detailed notes for follow-up and reporting.

card3.title: Bus & Transport Coordination
card3.subtitle: Ensuring timely departures
card3.body:
• Confirm bus pickup points and times 24 hours in advance.
• Coordinate with transport team for any delays or changes.
• Ensure all pilgrims are accounted for before departure.
• Have backup contact numbers for drivers and coordinators.
• Document any incidents or issues during transport.

card4.title: Medical Emergency Response
card4.subtitle: First aid and emergency protocols
card4.body:
• Know the location of nearest medical stations at each site.
• Keep emergency contact numbers readily available (911, medical team).
• Document all medical incidents with details and timestamps.
• Escalate serious cases immediately to medical staff.
• Follow up with pilgrims after medical assistance.

card5.title: Crowd Management & Safety
card5.subtitle: Keeping pilgrims safe in crowded areas
card5.body:
• Monitor crowd levels using the app's crowd level monitor.
• Guide pilgrims away from high-crowd areas when possible.
• Ensure pilgrims stay with the group and have visible identification.
• Report any safety concerns to security immediately.
• Keep a headcount during movement between sites.

card6.title: Lost Pilgrim Protocol
card6.subtitle: What to do when a pilgrim is separated
card6.body:
• Immediately check the Lost & Found section in the app.
• Contact security and provide pilgrim's digital ID details.
• Use the app to send location updates to the pilgrim if possible.
• Document the incident with time, location, and circumstances.
• Follow up until the pilgrim is safely reunited with the group.

card7.title: Meal Planning & Distribution
card7.subtitle: Coordinating meal services
card7.body:
• Plan daily meals using the Meals section in the app.
• Add meal details: type, time, items, and dietary tags.
• Send meal plans to pilgrims via "Send to Users" button.
• Coordinate with catering for special dietary requirements.
• Ensure meals are delivered on time and in correct quantities.

card8.title: Announcement Management
card8.subtitle: Communicating with your group
card8.body:
• Review admin announcements and share relevant information with pilgrims.
• Mark announcements as read after reviewing.
• Use clear, simple language when communicating updates.
• Prioritize urgent announcements (weather, schedule changes).
• Confirm that important messages are received and understood.

card9.title: Daily Reporting & Documentation
card9.subtitle: Keeping accurate records
card9.body:
• Document all incidents, requests, and notable events daily.
• Update group status and attendance records regularly.
• Report any issues or concerns to supervisors promptly.
• Maintain clear communication logs with pilgrims.
• Review and verify all data before submitting reports.
